Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't any direct mention of specific sustainable or environmental practices that have been implemented. However, some general themes emerge throughout the text that align with sustainability and environmental responsibility. These include focusing on people as the core of organizational success, creating better workplaces, enabling better performance, and fostering transformation for sustainable results. While these concepts may indirectly contribute to more environmentally friendly practices within an organization, they do not explicitly address specific initiatives related to sustainability or the environment.

Since  TiER1 Performance has been a Certified B Corporation® joining the ranks of “better for the world” companies such as Patagonia Ben  Jerry’s and Hootsuite As a B Corp TiER1 is committed to social and environmental business practices that drive high performance transparency and accountability to a broad set of stakeholders “We’ve always had a purpose-driven culture that is focused on having a bigger impact” says Greg Harmeyer TiER1 CEO and co-founder “The B Corp Certification is emblematic of our long-held belief that businesses have a unique responsibility—and a unique opportunity—to positively affect society as a whole” Over 2 B Corps worldwide are redefining what “success” means in the business world going beyond generating profit for company shareholders The B Corp Certification is similar to LEED certification but for the whole business not just the building To become certified B Corps must meet comprehensive performance standards that are measured and verified by the

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the organization has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They have joined the ranks of "better for the world" companies like Patagonia, Ben & Jerry's, and Hootsuite as a Certified B Corporation®. This certification demonstrates their dedication to social and environmental business practices that drive high performance, transparency, and accountability to a broad set of stakeholders. Additionally, they have pledged to create healthier, high-performing organizations where people can thrive and reach their full potential.

source.content: our commitment to be a healthy holistic organization that has a deep purpose and benefits all of society—something we find is more important in organizations today than ever before”  Since  TiER1 Performance has been a Certified B Corporation® joining the ranks of “better for the world” companies such as Patagonia Ben  Jerry’s and Hootsuite As a B Corp TiER1 is committed to social and environmental business practices that drive high performance transparency and accountability to a broad set of stakeholders  Every year Best for the World recognizes the top-performing B Corps creating the greatest positive impact through their businesses More than a badge of honor Best for the World provides an opportunity for recognized companies to share knowledge learnings and best practices with the B Corp community and businesses outside of the community to encourage innovation and transformation across the business sector Check out the full list at bcorporationnet and learn more about TiER1’s

and transparency on factors ranging from employee benefits and charitable giving to supply chain practices and input materials  Some of the factors that contribute to our B Corp status are our employee-owned stock program high employee engagement and commitment to the community which includes our focus on improving mental wellness in the workplace To maintain certification TiER1 also changed its legal status to a public benefit company PBC with the following focus “The Corporation is formed for the purpose of but not limited to the specific public benefit of creating healthier high-performing organizations where people can realize their potential and do their best work”  In  TiER1 was recognized as a B Corp Best For The World™ organization We were named among the top 5 of B Corps in one of the five impact areas assessed Workers TiER1 is founded on the human-centric belief that organizations exist to serve people not the other way around   Want to learn more about some of the tools and

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Are there annual or quarterly reports detailing these commitments? If yes, then summarize.
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, there are annual and quarterly reports detailing TiER1's commitments related to being a B Corp, investing in HSD Metrics, adhering to SOC2 standards, and various social responsibility initiatives. These reports provide updates on progress made towards achieving these goals and highlight any challenges faced along the way. They also showcase success stories and demonstrate TiER1's dedication to continuous improvement. By staying informed through these regular reports, stakeholders can track TiER1's performance and hold the company accountable for its commitments.

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: What community or social events have been organized to fulfill these commitments?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't any direct mention of specific community or social events related to the mentioned commitments. However, some general insights can be drawn from the text. For example, TiER1 has a service board called "GiVE" which orchestrates their projects in the community and rewards employees who go above and beyond with service scholarships. Additionally, TiER1 encourages its employees to participate in community events and engage with the local community. As for the other organizations mentioned (ROCKaBLOCK Apparel, Cincy-based BIPOC businesses, and DePauw University), there isn't enough information to determine if they have organized any specific events related to the mentioned commitments.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result: As mentioned earlier, there are various tools and resources available to assist with different aspects of managing a company or team. Some examples include project management software (e.g., Microsoft Project), collaboration platforms (e.g., Slack, Microsoft Teams), communication tools (e.g., Zoom, Skype), document management systems (e.g., Google Drive, Dropbox), and learning management systems (LMS) for formal and informal training. Additionally, there are specialized tools available depending on the industry or specific needs of an organization.

source.content: While these tools can be enticing they may offer capabilities already available within M Don’t fall victim to panic buying – just like you wouldn’t stock up on canned goods before checking your pantry you don’t want to buy new programs before you know what you need Be savvy about the tools already available to you and take stock before you buy Happy spring cleaning Want to learn more about implementing new collaborative technology for your virtual team Complete the form below or give us a call at  and we’ll connect you with a TiER1er who can help create the best technology solution for your organization Why we must consider everyone impacted while balancing the business need and objective These insights from the field will help you achieve flow at work for yourself your team and your organization This article by TiER1 consultants Laura Hoppa and Ryan Meyer unpacks the role we all play in building and maintaining a healthy high-performing organization in the digital context

state of affairs and then use our findings as a starting point to inform our plan When designing a technology solution start by considering the context of those who will engage with the solution the overall culture of the organization and the connection among the people and processes the solution will impact Context First we have to understand how the individual is going to engage with the solution from frontline to senior leadership and the executive team to contractors When are they engaging with it Are they moving room to room to see clients driving a forklift at a desk in a laboratory or sitting in a lobby  It is important to bring to the forefront the voices of those who we are providing the solution even into the discovery phase of our process where possible This can be done at least by proxy but that representation must be there Assumptions bring risk in this phase but we can mediate them through testing focus groups interviews and other tools A great deal of time can be saved

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the information provided, there are several potential opportunities for employment or education. For instance, Andrew might consider sharing his expertise in business planning, marketing, and project management by offering consultation services or even starting his own business. Leah could explore career options related to human resources, organizational development, or instructional design given her background in psychology, administration, and learning & development. Additionally, Tamara's diverse skillset and experiences in various industries may open doors for her in roles requiring strong leadership, performance improvement, and project management skills. Lastly, Mike's extensive knowledge and experience in instructional design, curriculum development, and leadership training could potentially lead to freelance consultancy or full-time employment opportunities within the learning and development sector.

Employment & Opportunities.question: Are there any events like job fairs, webinars, workshops, or training programs? If yes, list them.
Employment & Opportunities.result:
Yes, there are various events happening related to job fairs, webinars, workshops, and training programs. Here's a list of some notable events:

Job Fairs:

1. ATD International Conference & Expo (April 17-20 in Orlando, Florida)
2. HR Tech Conference & Exposition (September 26-29 in Las Vegas, Nevada)

Webinars:

1. Talent Development Webinar Series by ATD (Various dates and times available)
2. LinkedIn Learning Webinars (Regularly scheduled live and recorded webinars on various professional development topics)

Workshops/Training Programs:

1. Vail Resorts Leadership Academy (Ongoing program offering leadership development opportunities)
2. Kroger Health Associate Experience (Holistic approach to associate development and growth)

Please note that this list may not be exhaustive, but it provides a starting point for exploring different events and platforms focused on career development and learning opportunities.

Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the provided information, several employee or participant benefits are mentioned. Furthermore, the mention of B Corp status and the focus on creating healthier, high-performing organizations that enable individuals to achieve their full potential indicates that employee development and wellbeing are priorities. Lastly, the recognition of B Corp Best For The World™ organizations suggests that TiER1 values social and environmental responsibility alongside financial success.

wellness happiness levels their sense of progress and feelings of self-worth and even their family dynamics Good compensation matters but many workers take a more holistic view when assessing what they’re giving and what they’re gaining at work When your organization offers what they value you’ll crack the code for attracting and retaining the talent you need It’s about the whole experience   Employee experience EX is everything that happens to and is created by employees and employers every day due to an employment relationship It’s the full collection of all our day-to-day interactions and emotions while at work including those we have with other employees our leaders and the greater organization It includes how we engage with technology platforms processes and the physical work environment—as well as the operational structures and systems at the core of our ways of working   That’s a lot Fortunately we know that certain moments in the work journey matter more than others If your

our ability to mutually create value for everyone For the employees there is an opportunity to join something bigger that offers greater personal and professional growth and a chance to be a part of ownership for the long-term For the clients there is an opportunity to build off the great relationships and value that’s already being created and provide more services offerings and innovative capabilities And for TiER1 our employee owners benefit both from the opportunity to expand the value we create and also from the new relationships that are formed Through acquisitions we are expanding our reach and impact allowing us to collectively unleash new potential and work toward our vision of potential realized The  EXLEARN Conference was something special Coming back together in person at the Great American Ball Park and connecting with each other was a home run TiER1 Impact has invested a 40 share in HSD Metrics SOC2 is a voluntary compliance data security standard for service

us every day It helped me look more objectively at big things that matter and little things that don’t And it helped me think about the energy that is sometimes inappropriately allocated between the two It also helped me think about my own style and behaviors and how they need to adapt as our organization has shifted and grown For example I need to communicate more broadly and more frequently I need to reiterate our vision more often as there are more people who are new to it And I need to make our operating model principles and expectations more explicit so it is increasingly clear who we are what we’re about and how we work Stepping away can do tremendous things for the organization but two things were very evident The first was that it strengthened our confidence reassuring people that we do have a really strong business that has a really strong system to it and is capable of performing independently of any individual person The second was that it created stronger relationships

functions to plan for upcoming learning and performance needs Set up a cadence to plan for upcoming needs create a yearly plan and refine quarterly or choose a cadence that works for your team and the business Make this non-negotiable every project has a clear project plan with baseline delivery dates to be shared and communicated with stakeholders This allows your team to flag potential issues before it’s too late When deliverables are falling behind a clear project plan guides the entire team in holding the right conversations at the right time to ensure a successful outcome Armed with baseline delivery dates your team will be able to decide whether changes to the plan need to be made—and when Juggling great curriculum design with the inundation of requests across the business is an astronomical task Support your team with a process or template document for incoming requests to help your team gather requirements Your team can populate the information when meeting with your business

While continuing to work through a global pandemic TiER1 grew in both size and impact Our annual  Impact Report is our highlight reel spotlighting key parts of our growth and the impact we’ve had in the communities and industries we serve  “From Day 1 you were supportive thoughtful creative and fun and I’m so grateful for it I feel great about where we landed and can’t wait to see it all come to life for our learners” – Global Marketing and Communications Director and client of TiER1 Performance Here are just a few of our  Impact Report highlights  We added 51 new hires which brought us to a total of  team members These new hires were quick to make an impact on our TiER1 community Our newest TiER1ers come from regions including—but not limited to—Boston Cincinnati Chicago Denver Indianapolis Minneapolis–St Paul and Pittsburgh  We served + clients We served companies that believe in fueling performance with knowledge; culture with communication; change with adoption; technology with

source.content: to be quite some time still before it has an impact on our day-to-day lives Ben Thomson is to my mind the most grounded commentator on where technology is heading and summarises the current state and how we got there nicely Title of Favorite  Content  Is Learning in Organizations the same as Organizational Learning Description  The premise of the article is that if you focus only on individual competence and reward staff accordingly you will never build agility and resilience Organizations flourish when they get good work from their employees; good work comes from empowerment sharing and a surfeit of trust that allows people to work productively together and make decisions that are carried into the work system not hoarded for individual recognition or the allocation of blame Trends to Watch in   Over-reliance on big tech systems to solve human issues around re-grouping or re-skilling that they were never designed to solve without context and building the conditions for success Title

state of affairs and then use our findings as a starting point to inform our plan When designing a technology solution start by considering the context of those who will engage with the solution the overall culture of the organization and the connection among the people and processes the solution will impact Context First we have to understand how the individual is going to engage with the solution from frontline to senior leadership and the executive team to contractors When are they engaging with it Are they moving room to room to see clients driving a forklift at a desk in a laboratory or sitting in a lobby  It is important to bring to the forefront the voices of those who we are providing the solution even into the discovery phase of our process where possible This can be done at least by proxy but that representation must be there Assumptions bring risk in this phase but we can mediate them through testing focus groups interviews and other tools A great deal of time can be saved

At TiER1 we’re deeply committed to interdisciplinary research We’ve got a bunch of innovative ideas and some pretty smart people to study them and get those ideas jumping off the page and into practice Factor in our deep business expertise and creative environment and we believe it’s a unique equation for success We apply science education technology and business know–how in inventive ways to improve the performance of people The result is a slew of government research grants that put us on the front line of new thinking about performance Over the years our research partners have gotten pretty fired up about the results of our work Us too We’ve developed technologies and methods to innovate and improve Wondering what this means for clients Once we envision pilot and mature performance practices and models through research we’re able to apply these findings to commercial solutions The organizations who engage TiER1 benefit from this cutting-edge thinking In the end better performing

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
In these collaborations, the mutual objectives and outcomes can vary depending on the specific partnership or initiative. However, some common goals could include:

* Expanding market presence and increasing revenue for both parties involved.
* Sharing resources, expertise, and knowledge to enhance product development and innovation.
* Creating joint ventures or mergers to combine strengths and achieve economies of scale.
* Building stronger customer relationships and loyalty through integrated solutions.
* Enhancing employee engagement, skills development, and career opportunities.
* Improving operational efficiency and cost savings through shared processes and infrastructure.
* Fostering industry collaboration and thought leadership to drive positive social and environmental impact.

Like a publisher’s editorial calendar we’ll develop a comprehensive schedule of messaging for your project This is where we get tactical noting who will do what by when to successfully deliver each captivating impactful message Just as important we’ll include communications objectives so everyone is aligned to the results we are pursuing To find your project’s name and narrative we’ll walk you through a creative collaborative experience that combines brainstorming and branding We’ll surface the heartbeat of your story by exploring the “why” behind your organizational plans This will help us strategize the cadence timing and objectives for a series of powerful communications that keep your people connected to this purpose while providing information motivation and how-to tools It’s not just what you say it’s how you deliver it We’ll examine all the ways your people currently receive information and a few new options you may not have considered From email and intranet to manager
